author: cfinnberg
body:
Sorry if title is not explanatory but I don't know how to properly explain this with words (with code is easy ). 

When working with a function, variable scope is not working as expected with arrays.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Sample.ps1:
	$array = @('','')
	Set-Variable -Option AllScope -Name array
	Function func {
		$obj = New-Object PSObject
		$array += $obj
		#$private:c | Out-Null
		write-host "Number of elements in array: $($array.count)"
	}		
	func
	write-host "Number of elements in array: $($array.count)"

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
When executing & "./sample.ps1", $array.count should be 3 in both scopes

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
$array doesn't exist in inner scope and $array.count is 2 in outer scope

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.8
OS                             Darwin 17.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.0.0: T...
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

#Also fails in Windows 10:

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.15063.608
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.15063.608
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


```

Additional information
----------------
```none
Strange enough, if uncomment the commented line (#$private:c | Out-Null), 
then it works as expected. Please, note that is not even necessary to refer to 
the array variable, it is enough to mention some (even non-existent) $private variable.
But it doesn't work with other scopes ($local, $global, ...)
```
